record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name="taxcodes" and term="taxcodes table" and format.name="tax.codes" and syslanguage="en"
record.file.name: taxcodes
record.format.name: tax.codes

brief.brief: Creates a database of tax codes, with corresponding tax rates, for Service Manager to use to calculate tax amounts on contract details and during Invoice Creation.
In the basic case, the tax code is the two letter state abbreviation (For example, "ca" for California with tax at 8.75%).

detail.detail: Service Manager stores the tax rate with two decimal places.
Since most tax calculations refer to state sales tax, you may want to consider using the two character state abbreviations as the tax codes.
If you do not want to calculate tax amounts, it is not necessary to maintain this table.
